data: A lexical resource built upon WordNet, assigning sentiment scores (neutral, positive, negative) to individual word meanings (synsets).

Contains nearly 5,000 text snippets, which were collected from financial news and news drafts concerning Finnish companies traded on NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange. Each snippet is labeled as positive, negative, or neutral.
A dataset used to understand sentiment in financial texts, combining artificial intelligence and semantic network technology to better identify, interpret, and process opinions in this context.

Introduces entity-sentiment labeling to solve the challenge of titles containing multiple entities and potentially conflicting sentiments. This manually annotated dataset contains over 10,700 news headlines, providing insights into sentiment shifts regarding specific entities in financial news.

A text dataset of tokenized and labeled Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) speeches, meeting minutes, and press conferences. This resource aims to understand the impact of monetary policy on financial markets by analyzing the language used by the central bank.

An annotated dataset of relations in financial documents, containing approximately 29,000 instances and 22 relation types, spanning eight entity pairs (e.g., Person-Title, Organization-Money), extracted from SEC 10-X filing documents. Highly useful for identifying relationships between entities in financial reports.
Compiled from various news sources and evaluated by human experts, allowing researchers to explore how news headlines affect price movements, asset comparisons, and other financial events.
A Named Entity Recognition (NER) dataset specifically designed for the financial domain, useful for identifying and classifying financial entities in text data.

Provides a multilingual financial Natural Language Processing (NLP) dataset, containing real-world financial article headlines in 15 languages. It is labeled with high-level and low-level topics, useful for multi-class and multi-label classification tasks.

A collection containing question-answer pairs for in-depth analysis of financial reports. Written by financial experts, it focuses on deep reasoning over financial data, providing training data to answer complex financial queries.
